thread.title: Could Tilda Swinton take over from Peter Capaldi in Doctor Who? Actress hotly-tipped as next Time Lord
thread.title_full: Could Tilda Swinton take over from Peter Capaldi in Doctor Who? Actress hotly-tipped as next Time Lord

author: Vicki Newman
title: Could Tilda Swinton take over from Peter Capaldi in Doctor Who? Actress hotly-tipped as next Time Lord
text:
Could Tilda Swinton take over from Peter Capaldi as the Doctor? Share     
Tilda Swinton could be the next Doctor. 
The actress is being hotly-tipped to take over from Peter Capaldi in Doctor Who . 
Bookies are placing their bets on the Doctor Strange star to be the next Time Lord. 
Scottish Peter, 58, announced last month that he was stepping down from the role after playing the character - recently voted the world's second favourite BBC character - since 2013. 
London-born Tilda, 56, who has starred in a number of hit films, such as The Curious Case of Benjamin Button, The Chronicle of Narnia series and The Beach, is rumoured to be taking over as the 13th Doctor. Read More Danny Dyer eyes up Doctor Who role and thinks he could 'easily' be a Time Lord Tilda is the bookies' favourite (Photo: Getty) 
A lot of rumours about who would take on the iconic role have been circulating since Peter announced his departure. 
The actor told the Mirror: "The time felt right to bow out, to let somebody else play this wonderful role. 
"And I would like Frances de la Tour to be the first female doctor." 
The show's executive producer Steven Moffat has previously suggested that a future generation of the character could be a women, saying: "I think the next time might be a female Doctor. I don't see why not." Peter has played the Doctor since 2013 (Photo: BBC) 
The odds in full:
